classes

Class Website

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Website

  • public class Website
extends java.lang.Object
    Website class represents one website the user wants to monitorize

    One website is characterized by :

    • A check Interval - it is given by the user in seconds - it tells us how often we do a check on a website
    • A date - when the website was added in the monitoring system
    • A unique id
    • A String url - it must be an existing url

    Author:
    gabriellerappaport

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.Integer checkInterval
      check interval : indicates the interval of seconds to wait between two checks.
      private java.util.Date date
      date : indicates when the website was added to the basis.
      private java.lang.Integer idWebsite
      idWebsite : unique id to identify the website in the databse
      private java.lang.String url
      url : used to do checks on the website

      Website(java.lang.Integer idWebsite, java.lang.String url, java.lang.Integer checkInterval, java.util.Date date)
      First Constructor for a website This first method is useful when we retrieve a website stored in the database.
      Website(java.lang.String url, java.lang.Integer checkInterval)
      Second Constructor for a website This second method is useful when we need to create a Website Object from the CLUI In fact, we only know the url and idCheck in the CLUI, the idWebsite and date will be generated when the website is stored in the database.

    • Field Detail

      • checkInterval

        private java.lang.Integer checkInterval
        check interval : indicates the interval of seconds to wait between two checks. It can be modified my the user anytime.

      • date

        private java.util.Date date
        date : indicates when the website was added to the basis. The date is updated when the user updates the check interval.

      • idWebsite

        private java.lang.Integer idWebsite
        idWebsite : unique id to identify the website in the databse

      • url

        private java.lang.String url
        url : used to do checks on the website

    • Constructor Detail

      • Website

        public Website(java.lang.Integer idWebsite,
               java.lang.String url,
               java.lang.Integer checkInterval,
               java.util.Date date)
        First Constructor for a website

        This first method is useful when we retrieve a website stored in the database. In fact, we can set every parameter of the Object. Most particularly, the websiteId and the date are set when the website is stored in the database.

        Parameters:
        idWebsite - Unique Id of the website
        url - Functionnal url used to do the checks
        checkInterval - Second interval between two checks
        date - Date of the last checkInterval update

      • Website

        public Website(java.lang.String url,
               java.lang.Integer checkInterval)
        Second Constructor for a website

        This second method is useful when we need to create a Website Object from the CLUI In fact, we only know the url and idCheck in the CLUI, the idWebsite and date will be generated when the website is stored in the database. Thus, we can't set the informations yet.

        Parameters:
        url - Functionnal url used to do the checks
        checkInterval - Second interval between two checks
